Course Description.text: Language components, models of language production and comprehension, and theories of language development.

Course Description.text: Focus on learning and practicing grammatical techniques that today's expert writers use to increase rhetorical impact on the reader.

LIN4105 - History of the English Languag.name: LIN4105 - History of the English Language

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of the English language and its development from Old English to Modern.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Emphasis upon the analysis and comparison of traditional, structural, and transformational grammar.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Language study as an aid to understanding literature.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Procedures for sampling, analyzing, and describing language in children and adolescents.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An overview of the modern linguist's approach to language. Analytic methods of phonology, morphology, syntax. Brief systematic survey of dialectology, language acquisition, and semantics.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of language and meaning in social, civic, cultural, and professional settings.
